meanings.definition: A list or schedule of duties or tasks to be performed by individuals or groups in turn.
meanings.sent1: Every morning, the teacher writes the rotas on the board for the students to follow.
meanings.sent2: The rotas for cleaning duties are posted on the bulletin board every week.
meanings.sent3: The rotas for snack time caused a mix-up when two students tried to grab the same sandwich.
meanings.sent4: The rotas of responsibilities in the group spun like a colorful wheel, assigning tasks to each member.
meanings.sent5: The rotas, like a well-oiled machine, kept the classroom running smoothly.

meanings.definition: A wheel or disk that rotates on an axis.
meanings.sent1: The engineer carefully examined the intricate rotas of the machine to ensure proper functioning.
meanings.sent2: The rotas of the windmill turned gracefully in the breeze, generating electricity.
meanings.sent3: The rotas of the Ferris wheel delighted the children as they went round and round.
meanings.sent4: The rotas of the clock ticked away, marking the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The rotas of the carousel spun joyfully, carrying riders on a magical journey.
